name: phylogenetic-tree-tip
title: PhylogeneticTreeTip
description: A group of Taxa at the end of a branch of a PhylogeneticTree as determined from relationships between dwc:Organisms.

fields.name: phylogeneticTreeTipID
fields.title: Phylogenetic Tree Tip ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: phylogeneticTreeID
fields.title: Phylogenetic Tree ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: phylogeneticTreeTipLabel
fields.title: Phylogenetic Tree Tip Label
fields.description: A label applied to a PhylogeneticTreeTip.

fields.name: taxonID
fields.title: Taxon ID
fields.comments: In DwC-DP, the taxonID is always an external link to a taxon record. As such, if present, it should be a resolvable globally unique identifier. See the Identifiers section of https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp/blob/master/README.md.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description: A full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in dwc:verbatimIdentification.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Roptrocerus typographi (Gy√∂rfi, 1952)` (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.title: Material Entity ID
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: nucleotideSequenceID
fields.title: Nucleotide Sequence ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
